data.name: Longbowman
data.description:
Cheap long-ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.

+ Long range

+ Can construct Palings to fend off cavalry charges

- Slow movement speed

data.name: Villager
data.description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units.

+ Uses a bow to attack

- Weak in combat

data.name: Wynguard Army
data.description: Produces an army including one each of Longbowman, Spearman, Man-at-Arms, Knight, and Trebuchet.

data.description:

+ Melee attack deals area damage

data.name: Prelate
data.description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Automatically inspires Villagers to greatly improve their gather rate. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites starting in the Castle Age (III).

+ Heals friendly units

- Low health

data.name: Royal Ribauldequin
data.description:
Five-barreled gunpowder weapon effective against massed units. Deals little damage to buildings.

+ Can hit multiple targets in a single volley

- Short range

- Low ranged armor

data.name: Trader
data.description: Traders generate Gold when assigned to trade with a Trade Post or another player’s Market. Once assigned to trade, the Trader makes repeated trips between its Home Market and the Trade Target. You can assign a new Home Market if you wish to.

data.name: Bombard

data.name: Fire Lancer
data.description:
Unarmored cavalry wielding explosive-tipped lances for an impressive charge attack.

+ Charge deals area damage

+ Effective raiding unit against buildings and siege engines

- Weak in melee combat

data.name: Grenadier
data.description:
Advanced ranged infantry with thrown explosive canisters that deal damage in a small area.

+ Deals area damage

- Short range

- Slow movement speed

data.name: Imperial Official
data.description:
Economic support unit with no combat capability. Will automatically gather Tax (Gold) from buildings.

+ Can be tasked with improving a building’s efficiency

- Only a certain number of Officials can exist at a time

data.name: Mangonel
data.description:
Fires multiple projectiles dealing damage in an area.

+ Effective against massed units

- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Nest of Bees
data.description:
Innovative field weapon capable of firing a barrage of rockets to damage defensive positions and clumped enemy troops.

+ Good area of effect damage against most targets

- Slowest movement speed

- Weak if surrounded

data.description:

+ Armored

- Countered by Crossbowmen, Knights, and Lancers

data.name: Springald
data.description:
Effective at taking out high value targets at long range. Fires after quickly setting up.

+ Long range

+ Bonus damage vs siege engines

- Trivial damage vs. buildings

data.name: Trebuchet
data.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.

+ Bonus damage vs buildings

- Must be set up to fire

- Inaccurate against units

- Low health

data.name: Khaganate Units
data.description: Spawns a cavalry army of Horsemen, Mangudai, or Lancers every 90 seconds.

data.name: Khan
data.description:
Potent ranged cavalry leader able to ignite Signal Arrows to improve the combat capabilities of nearby military units. Reappears at a Town Center if killed.

+ Vision of a Scout

+ Herds sheep

+ High utility in large armies

+ Automatically improves as the Ages are advanced

- Only a single Khan per Mongol Civilization at a time

+ High damage

+ Lower cost than Handcannoneer
